Key Match Events: Jose Ramirez's bad-hop bouncer to third baseman Zach McKinstry was given a rapid review and changed to an RBI double, scoring five runs in the first inning and contributing to the Guardians' 7-0 win over the Tigers.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch went to right-hander Reese Olson as planned after Josh Naylor's RBI single, but Olson's first pitch to Lane Thomas was deposited in the left-field seats, giving the Guardians a 5-0 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers and Guardians play Game 2 on Monday at 4:08 p.m. at Progressive Field.

The critical error in the Detroit Tigers' Game 1 loss in the American League Division Series on Saturday is no longer an error, with Jose Ramirez's bad-hop bouncer to third baseman Zach McKinstry being given a rapid review and changed to an RBI double.
Others: Zach McKinstry took responsibility for the error after the game but also suggested he wasn’t prepared for the hop because of the grounds crew’s irregular infield watering.
